title: Product model workflow
content:
This page explains the product model workflow and the steps to perform the following tasks:

  • View workflow and current phase of product model
  • Change phase of product model

Product model workflow

The product model workflow describes the different metaphases and phases in the lifecycle of a product model. Metaphases represent broad stages in the lifecycle, while phases are the specific steps within each stage.

The product model lifecycle consists of the following metaphases:

  • Planning
  • Consumable
  • Retired (End)

The following figure shows the product model workflow.

The following table describes the phases within each metaphase.

Metaphase Phase Description Allowed transitions Transition type
Planning Draft After creating the product model, it is in the Draft phase by default. Keep the product model in the Draft phase until it is ready to use.

Draft to Active,

Draft to Inactive

Consumable Active Move the product model to the Active phase when it is ready for use or has active customers. Active to Inactive Manual
Retired (End) Inactive Move the product model to the Inactive phase when it is no longer in use or when support for the product model has ended. Inactive to Active,
Inactive to Draft		 Manual

View workflow and current phase of product model

  1. Click    > Plan > Company.
  2. In the Companies dropdown, click Product Models. 
  3. Click the product model.
  4. Click the Workflow tab. This displays the workflow, and the current phase is highlighted in blue.

Change phase of product model

To change the phase of a product model:

  1. Click    > Plan > Company.
  2. In the Companies dropdown, click Product Models. 
  3. Click the product model. This directs you to the General tab of the product model.
  4. Click the phase button   on the upper-right side of the page to change the phase to the next phase, or select the appropriate phase from the dropdown.
  5. Click Save.
